org.apache.edgent.oplet.plumbing

Class Barrier<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.edgent.oplet.core.AbstractOplet<T,U>
      • org.apache.edgent.oplet.core.FanIn<T,java.util.List<T>>
        • org.apache.edgent.oplet.plumbing.Barrier<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the tuple.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Oplet<T,java.util.List<T>>

    public class Barrier<T>
extends FanIn<T,java.util.List<T>>
    A tuple synchronization barrier.

    Barrier has n input ports with tuple type T and one output port with tuple type List<T>. Once the oplet receives one tuple on each of its input ports, it generates an output tuple containing one tuple from each input port. It then awaits receiving the next collection of tuples. Input port 0's tuple is in list[0], port 1's tuple in list[1], and so on.

    Each input port has an associated queue of size queueCapacity. The input port's Consumer<T>.accept() will block if it's queue is full.
